FuncDef:
The using command configures a working mode for an E1 interface.
The undo using command restores the default setting.
By default, an E1 interface works in channelized mode.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the channelized mode or unchannelized mode.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
An E1 interface can work in either of the following modes:
Channelized mode or unchannelized mode: An E1 interface is divided into 32 timeslots. Timeslots 1 to 31 can be bundled into several channel-sets, with each functioning as a synchronous serial interface working at N x 64kbit/s.Clear channel mode: An E1 interface is not divided into timeslots and does not support the channel-set command. Instead, it is used as a 2.048 Mbit/s serial interface.
The using command allows you to configure the working mode of an E1 interface.

Follow-up Procedure
If an E1 interface works in channelized mode or unchannelized mode, run the channel-set command to bundle the timeslots of the E1 interface into several channel-sets.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
Before changing the working mode of an E1 interface, note the following:
To switch an E1 interface from the channelized mode or unchannelized mode to the clear channel mode, delete the channelized configurations and run the using e1 command.To switch an E1 interface from the clear channel mode to the channelized mode or unchannelized mode, delete the clear channel configurations and configurations under the synchronous serial interface (without the need to delete the synchronous serial interface), and run the using ce1 or undo using command.
